name: Milagres Church
excerpt: The imposing Roman-style Milagres Church is in the city centre.
detail_description: The imposing Roman-style Milagres Church is in the city centre.

name: Kadri Manjunatha Temple
excerpt: This Kerala-style temple houses a 1000-year-old bronze statue of Lokeshwara.
detail_description: This Kerala-style temple houses a 1000-year-old bronze statue of Lokeshwara.

name: Sultan’s Battery
excerpt: The only remnant of Tipu Sultan’s fort is this small lookout with views over scenic backwaters. It’s 4km from the city centre on the headland of the old…
detail_description: The only remnant of Tipu Sultan’s fort is this small lookout with views over scenic backwaters. It’s 4km from the city centre on the headland of the old port.

name: Ullal Beach
excerpt: This stretch of golden sand is a good destination to escape the city heat. It’s 12km south of Mangaluru, across the Netravathi estuary. An Uber…
detail_description: This stretch of golden sand is a good destination to escape the city heat. It’s 12km south of Mangaluru, across the Netravathi estuary. An Uber/autorickshaw is around ₹200 one way, or take bus 44A or 44C (₹12) from the City bus stand.

name: St Aloysius College Chapel
excerpt: Catholicism’s roots in Mangaluru date back to the arrival of the Portuguese in the early 1500s. One impressive legacy is the 1880 Sistine Chapel–like St…
detail_description: Catholicism’s roots in Mangaluru date back to the arrival of the Portuguese in the early 1500s. One impressive legacy is the 1880 Sistine Chapel–like St Aloysius chapel, its walls and ceilings painted with brilliant frescos. No photography is permitted.

name: Pilikula Nisarga Dhama
excerpt: A kind of eco-educational theme park, Pilikula is spread over 149 hectares and includes a tropical forest, an arboretum, a herb garden full of rare…
detail_description: A kind of eco-educational theme park, Pilikula is spread over 149 hectares and includes a tropical forest, an arboretum, a herb garden full of rare medicinal plants, an artisan village with craft-making demonstrations, a zoo, a science centre and a lake. The 3D Planetarium (films in English at noon and 4pm daily) is certainly worth taking in. It's 8km east of central Mangaluru. Buses 3A, 3B and 3C head here from Mangaluru, or an Ola/Uber is around ₹200.
